title-group.article-title: A Test of the Agency Theory of Managerial Ownership, Corporate Leverage, and Corporate Dividends

abstract.p: Evidence is presented supporting the agency theory explanation for the behavior of managerial ownership, corporate leverage, and corporate dividends. Furthermore, the findings are consistent with the conclusion that corporate managers use these three decisions in tandem to reduce the agency costs arising from the public ownership of the corporation.
